I see that the timer is off and it is showing my posts at two hours before I actually post them....I wanted you to know because I didn't want you to think that I am overly ambitious. Much love...Jenn

Dear Family and Friends, I am making this Blog for you. I will post photos of what I have been doing recently and maybe not so recently....and try to update it often. I am gaining more knowlege on the use of my web cam and hopt to be able to entertain you and keep closer to you by way of the web instead of sending you cumbersome downloads. Love, Jenn

urlLink Ketchen took me for my birthday lunch to a place called The Hard Wok....There was a pan of these....under the warmer...they are peach shaped bean curd dumplings....sort of ick..though I brought this one home and Jayden ate it...I could only get through half of one at the restaurant. Like a boiled dumpling on the outside, I don't know how they shaped it like a peach...but on the inside, dark brown bean curd paste.....very bizzare...like refried beans with lots of sugar....interesting.... It is this year's birthday cake.... urlLink

As I look at my posting so far this week it occurs to me that Michael is doing things and the rest of us are just laying around at J-East. Randy's house. We do things too...but the camera is always near when I am by those I love...and weekends are full of that...Randy makes it easy for us to hang around and relax. The Seymour Amish countryside makes it easy to forget the world of working folks and just hang around doing silly things... This week I have been more focused in the arts...I think when school starts I always feel the urge to buy pens and tablets, backpacks and new shoes....This week Jayden and I splurged and bought not just necessities but a few sketch pads, charcoal pencils, colored pencils, paint brushes etc...we are having a fun time sketching things that make us laugh...and as you have seen, my art can be laughable....frankly I have been miserable about drawing eyes which have been a particular interest to me recently in photography...perhaps I'll pay more attention to noses and mouths next....or even funnier...maybe bellies....of course most of you are guessing who the bellies belong to....LOL...but that last one? It belongs to Santa Claus.....yes, Santa....could you see the beard? In real life, Shannon's Dad, Art. Thanks Art for the Artful belly shot! Next week my neighbor Abby will be staying with us...so expect more delightful photos of her bronzed face and happy smile.... I heard from Sage yesterday...enjoying his trip to Oregon with his Dad....looking forward to his return next week.... Erin and Jack will spend another week with Randy, which smells of creek trips, crawdad catching and Jack's 9th birthday..... Painting Randy's bedroom is up for consideration in the comming weeks...it is a sky blue now...I am thinking of topping it with a white glaze in a cloudy/foggy finish.... I bought a new paint book today at Lowes....anyone have a blank wall that they'll let me work on? I am dying to try the brick look and also the marble finishes.... If you're following my blog...I'd love to hear from you....feel free to join and post a comment or just send me an email.....thanks for stopping by, Jenn

urlLink I know, I know. This is an old photo but I am trying to load it onto my blog ID as my passport photo LOL showing that I am LOL a photographer...do I look believable? Not as if...anyone cares...I need the URL. please bear with me...PS. This photo taken in January 04 with a Nikon 75(?) and then developed the old fashioned way and then photographed by my digital and posted on the web...thus the glare. urlLink
urlLink Here is K having Randy work on her lap top computer...see how funny Blossom is curled up next to her butt? Close ups comming... urlLink

urlLink Big Kiss....See Sage's hair...it's in a short pony tail...LOL urlLink

Goodmorning....for now all I have is words....Today K is leaving for Tennesee and will be gone for maybe 4 days so I will look after Goldie and her 10 golden retriever pups. They are in K's garrage. Sage and Jayden just left to swim in K's pool. I still did not get photos of the bathroom at J-East. I have the list of supplies and costs and it is a good list.... I'll start by saying that this bathroom was the color of a plastic mustard bottle...I look bad in yellow anyway..(haha) but there was something unsettling about the color...there are no before photos...sorry...I could have been much more efficient with cost here...but it was the first room at Randy's that I started and I am still not very done yet... There was plastic panneling about 4 feet high around three walls. It was originally white but was all painted mustard yellow. When I realized that it would come off and still leave sheet rock on the wall, I immediately set to work ripping it down. I don't know why it was so horribly offensive to me. I bought a bucket of spackle at Walmart for $6 Gallon White Paint--Habitat for Humanity $2 Opposing stripe-gallon-Habitat $1 Not bad so far...I needed to caulk around the shower and sink and had caulk leftover from a previous job so $0 You saw the picture titled unusual art....that is the old picture that was already there, I painted the frame the contrast color...and turned the picture around...glued some black and white beach prints and a sand dollar and three small star fish on the white picture backing and threw it all back into the frame for $0 on a 5 AM sleepless night.... So far I am into this job for $9 Then I splurge on a $5 oak towel bar and a $1 tp holder at Habitat. Finally I go back and get the molding....a bundle at Habitat...including the chair rail molding for the living room...this came to $2. Wow! Overbudget...my ten dollar bathroom remodel job is now up to $17.... I did buy myself a new mitre box at walmart to cut the molding but I needed one for possibly making easy photo frames and some molding work at my house....Randy and I each had mitre boxes but neither of us had the correct saw...this time I plan to keep them together.... The bathroom is stark white and has two stripes...the contrast stripe color was used for the picture frame, and for a table that is now being used as a bench in the dining room...and possibly will paint the dining room table top as well...I have also used this color to paint a shelf that I found in the closet there and intend to hang someplace as decorating progresses.... I am having so much fun with this...I am sure that the details bore you. And a question for Bill....Mitre Box with saw $9 same saw alone $11....what's with that? It's like they are paying me to get a new mitre box....LOL....

I have tried to photo cronicle the changes I've made at Randy's. He has cable TV and I have been watching some of the home shows there which have made me want to photograph the changes made to the house and keep a running tab on how much money the entire thing is costing. I can't believe it when I watch these shows and they spend $1,000 decorating each room on shows such as Trading Spaces etc. I have been more interested in Design on a Dime etc. I have kept track of the expenses and the places I've found much of the things used in this project and hope that the details are not a bore to you. So far the costs have been minimal for the living room, hallway and kitchen areas...Randy buying the paint and me shelling out only $15.45 for the accessories for the living room and including the $1.45 piece of material that I used to recover my old barstools with which you cannot see in the kitchen photos yet...I am going back out there tonight and will try to provide photos of that area soon. Comming soon will be pictures of the dining area and the bathroom which have been a bit more costly and thought provoking...but neither of those areas are complete yet. Thanks for following

urlLink Randy's old living room...the antique mirror on the far wall is hung low...I raised it three inches and took away much of the furniture and odds and ends. Randy scored a new couch and loveseat from a buddy for a bottle of Jack Daniels! Making this room renovation completely possible! urlLink

urlLink This shot of Randy's fireplace shows that at this point it is a work in progress. On the mantle now instead of slumping frameless photos are his muzzle loader (gun) and hand made bow that will soon be hanging along with some outdoor pictures taken from another wall. Everything in it's place..even his rock and bone collection is contained in a basket, leaving extra seating on pillows in front of the fireplace which rarely has a fire. The wooden and leather chair in front of the fish tank and the coffee table are the only things that stayed from the last arrangement. See how light and bright my cheap curtains look? Beautiful....and the chihuahua's box bed under the leather chair....ha ha urlLink

urlLink Randy's living room as was...this furniture was hauled to the basement for kid friendly tv watching. I don't want to complain...but too much furniture...too many things going on..too much stuff in this room and too many dark colors made me uneasy. urlLink

urlLink A view of Randy's living room much as it is today...I found the ores in his shed and they worked with the nautical theme of the couch fabric. The coffee table was beautiful but hard to see earlier. The plant is something I scavanged from the yard and also the pot that it is in...The new curtains cost about $4. This room is painted with Antique White Satin from Wal-Mart and Randy purchased 3 cans costing approx. $30. The molding on the far wall was thrown into a bundle of molding I purchased for the bathroom so $0. and hooks were purchased from Lowe's for the far wall for hats and jackets at the molding line $10. urlLink

urlLink Here you can see the entry to the kitchen from the living and dining areas...a large broken hat rack was here and after removed I could hang a material and ribbon photo board and put in all of the pictures of Erin and Jack that were once just slumping along the mantel. urlLink

urlLink This photo blury but you can see the space here when you walk in the door...Notice the chair rail molding on the far wall. Cutting down on clutter and hanging Randy's two favorite outdoor work hats makes the place homey, functional and personal while eliminating a broken hat rack that once blocked the entry to his kitchen. urlLink
urlLink A dark (sorry) view of the living room from the dining room. Lots of clean and clear lines now. This room feels peaceful and inviting. urlLink
urlLink Randy's old kitchen. Clean shown here still is dark and dreary with orange and blue. Under cabinet florescent light was unnecessary and after kitchen was brightened I removed it. urlLink

urlLink The beginning of the transformation for Randy's kitchen...Jayden painted the short space between the cupboards and ceiling antique white and we spot painted some places on the ceiling as well...now if we only knew what to do with so much orange! Again...This paint is the same as used in the rest of the house so total expense in this room so far has been $0. urlLink

urlLink Randy's front porch...painted railings by the kids and I....yes we scraped and swept first...For this we used a gallon of paint that I had to buy to paint my bathroom cabinet. It is durable and the paint store told me it would hold up on a boat dock! It made the porch railings look great....As the paint was just becoming useless in my garage...the cost for this renovation was FREE!!! Though a bit of sweat equity was involved...and a few popsicles. I'd like to paint the rest of the deck to match in the future. urlLink

urlLink Randy's old hallway in country blue. Empty bookshelf is blocking the door to Jack's room on the far right. Bathroom door in the right front and Randy's room on the left. This is the look of the hall after we replaced the hanging globe light fixture with a ceiling hugging fixture that I was given for FREE! urlLink
urlLink Randy's new hallway covered in Antique White. Empty Bookcase gone. Keep viewing for future artwork on the walls and some order to bookshelves at right. urlLink

urlLink Babysitting Annie today has not been much of a problem. I took a tiny nap and woke up with her in my arms....I slipped out from under her over an hour ago but she sleeps on....I hope she continues to be such a good pup. urlLink
urlLink Randy looks pleased with warm Annie in his lap. urlLink
urlLink This is Annie. Randy's new puppy. In Randy's arms. urlLink
urlLink Sage's first kiss with puppy. urlLink
urlLink Sage decides to call this puppy Dice...but then changes his name to Farty. Too bad! urlLink

urlLink Who's belly is this?...ok hint....this is a hip...belly on the right...bottom on the left..... urlLink

urlLink Vacationing with Randy and family. Randy had vacation time this week with his kids at home and even though I was desperately missing Sage...who is still vacationing with his dad...I took Jayden and Abby, my little adorable neighbor to Randy's. We got there on Friday and stayed until Wednesday morning when I had to get back to Springfield to take Chrissy to the Dr....baby due in two weeks now!!! And I am expecting Sage home any minute.... urlLink
urlLink Freckles. They belong to Erin. urlLink
urlLink Interrior of the van...Erin(Randy's girl), Abby(my neighbor), Jackson(Randy's boy), Jayden(my middle son) urlLink
urlLink She had the whole gravel bar...but had to lay on my towel at the creek....guess who smelled like a dog all afternoon? urlLink
urlLink Jackson staying in the house....you'll see why in the next photo..... urlLink

urlLink Jackson stepped on this copperhead snake in Randy's driveway....It gave poor Jack the heebs and he came running in to tell us all about it...he knew that I was hot for some interesting photos this week so he advised me to grab the camera...Bummer that as soon as I snapped this photo I also got creeped out and yelled at Randy for not killing it.....poor Randy...he just can't read my mind! urlLink
urlLink See my classy mardi gras beads for our creek trek? I was one big slice of fancy! After all, we were on vacation! urlLink
urlLink View of clover in Randy's back yard...his dog Sally blew on my camera and I believe fogged it up something good right in the middle.... urlLink
urlLink Jayden on our canoe creek trek...not only do we have Blossom and Annie at attention...honey is on Jayden's lap. urlLink

urlLink Right out of Randy's back yard...I feel lucky to drink my morning coffee on the covered deck and watch the horses in the field...a short walk brings me within horse smelling distance...I always enjoy seeing them standing there....Our view of horses that we don't have to feed or clean up after....wonderful country life. urlLink
urlLink Amish horses...right in Randy's back yard... urlLink
urlLink This is the best photo of the leach...looks like a small crawdad too...there will be more photos of these slippery characters comming up.... urlLink

urlLink Here's me....yes, I look sweet...but I spied on the Amish to give you a treat....I am sure that they would not have liked my Amish photo hobby this week....just couldn't help myself...they are so darn cute with their little hats and sweet faced horses...... urlLink

urlLink There is much Amish traffic past Randy's house as he lives in an area with many Amish neighbors...This is a picture of an Amish house. You can see the buggy parked out front with the orange triangle on the back that is manditory safety precaution these days...nothing else fancy, no electrical lines, no flowers, no garden...there was some laundry hanging on the porch but it does not really come out in the photo.... urlLink
urlLink An Amish couple. I don't know what they were doing...it looked like the man was just shaking out his legs....or possibly training the horses to just stop and be good... urlLink
urlLink I felt like a pervert taking photos of the Amish driving by from Randy's front porch...I felt especially guilty when they waved. urlLink
urlLink This view of Amish from Randy's front porch. urlLink
urlLink Abby's crawdads! urlLink
urlLink The closest photo of the 'leach' one of them had red spots on it's back but this one appears to have black spots....more to come. urlLink

urlLink This tiny green thing in the water is green with red spots...it is long and slippery. Randy tells me it is a leach. It certainly is interesting....I'd like to know more about these things...they seemed to be about 5 inches long..... urlLink
urlLink Amazing leach. urlLink
urlLink Abby showing me that bulging belly of hers. urlLink
urlLink My hand with a crawdad! urlLink

urlLink Abby at the creek...she calls it the creet... urlLink
urlLink Annie makes her first trip to the creek. urlLink
urlLink Getting in deeper. urlLink
urlLink This week on my quest for interesting photos. urlLink
urlLink I'd love to spell this for you but I can't...sorry. It is wild in the ozarks. urlLink

urlLink A few weeks ago I posted Catulpa worms on leaves...this is what is happening to the worms. They are covered with these tiny cotton type things and the things are hatching more worms...this seems to take alot out of the main host worms...there are also worms that appear bigger and have no eggs...I wonder if they are egg layers....interesting.... urlLink
urlLink Annie bites my nose! urlLink
